org.jcvi.jillion.trace.fastq

Class FastqFileParserBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.trace.fastq.FastqFileParserBuilder

  • public final class FastqFileParserBuilder
extends Object
    Creates a FastqParser that parses the given fastq encoded file along with additional configuration options to support FastqVisitor.FastqVisitorCallback.FastqVisitorMementos , multiline fastq records that take more than 4 lines each and also allows parsing comments on the deflines of fastq records.
    Author:
    dkatzel
    API Note:
    Example usage for creating a FastqParser for a gzipped file that has more than 4 lines per record would look like this: 
      
 File fastqFile = new File("my.fastq.gz");
 FastqParser parser = new FastqFileParserBuilder(fastqFile)
                                   .hasMultilineSequences(true)
                                   .build();
    Since:
    5.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • FastqFileParserBuilder

        public FastqFileParserBuilder(InputStream in)
        Create a new Builder instance that will parse the given fastq encoded InputStream. Please Note that inputStream implementations of the FastqFileParser can only be parsed once and will not not create FastqVisitorMementos or use FastqParser#parse(FastqVisitor, FastqVisitorMemento) method.
        API Note:
        if you have a compressed file that you want to be able to parse multiple times, use FastqFileParserBuilder(File) if the compressed file is one of the supported file types or FastqFileParserBuilder(InputStreamSupplier, boolean) if you want to provide your own InputStreamSupplier impelentation.
        Parameters:
        in - the fastq encoded InputStream to parse; can not be null.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if inputstream is null.
        See Also:
        FastqFileParserBuilder(File), FastqFileParserBuilder(InputStreamSupplier, boolean)

      • FastqFileParserBuilder

        public FastqFileParserBuilder(File fastqFile)
                       throws IOException
        Create a Builder that will parse the given fastq encoded File without memento support.
        API Note:
        this is the same as new FastqFileParserBuider(fastqFile, false);
        Parameters:
        fastqFile - the fastq file to be parsed; can not be null but may be a "normal" fastq file, or zipped or gzipped.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file is not readable
        NullPointerException - if file is null.

      • FastqFileParserBuilder

        public FastqFileParserBuilder(File fastqFile,
                              boolean mementoSupport)
                       throws IOException
        Create a Builder that will parse the given fastq encoded File.
        Parameters:
        fastqFile - the fastq file to be parsed; can not be null but may be a "normal" fastq file, or zipped or gzipped.
        mementoSupport - the FastqFileParser that will be built by this builder should be able to make mementos. Adding memento support requires extra processing time so it is usually false by default.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file is not readable
        NullPointerException - if file is null.
        Since:
        5.0
        See Also:
        FastqParser.canCreateMemento()

      • FastqFileParserBuilder

        public FastqFileParserBuilder(InputStreamSupplier inputStreamSupplier,
                              boolean mementoSupport)
        Create a Builder that will parse the given fastq encoded data provided by the InputStreamSupplier.
        Parameters:
        inputStreamSupplier - the fastq encoded data to be parsed that is in the InputStream returned by the given InputStreamSupplier can not be null.
        mementoSupport - the FastqFileParser that will be built by this builder should be able to make mementos. Adding memento support requires extra processing time so it is usually false by default.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if inputStreamSupplier is null.
        Since:
        5.0
        See Also:
        FastqParser.canCreateMemento()

    • Method Detail

      • hasComments

        public FastqFileParserBuilder hasComments(boolean hasComments)
        Does this fastq file contain comments on the deflines. If not called, then by default this builder uses hasComments = false.
        Parameters:
        hasComments - do the deflines of the sequences contain comments. If set to true then a more computationally intensive parsing is performed to try to distinguish the id from the comment. Remember some Fastq id's can have spaces which makes comment detection difficult and complex.
        Returns:
        this

      • hasMultilineSequences

        public FastqFileParserBuilder hasMultilineSequences(boolean multiline)
        Does this fastq file contain records that may have multiple lines for the sequence and qualities sequences. Most fastq files define each record in 4 lines:
        1. The defline
        2. nucleotide sequence
        3. The quality defline
        4. quality sequence
        However, some fastq files split the nucleotide and quality sequences over multiple lines. For performance reasons, checking for multi-lines has been turned off by default and must be explicitly turned on by calling this method.
        Parameters:
        multiline - true if this file may contain multilines; false otherwise (defaults to false.
        Returns:
        this

      • build

        public FastqParser build()
                  throws IOException
        Creates a new FastqParser object which will parse the given Fastq encoded file using the provided options.
        Returns:
        a new FastqParser; will never be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem creating the parser object.
